meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, he felt sick and had to regur.
meanings.sent2: The baby regurred all over the floor after drinking too quickly.
meanings.sent3: She regretted eating the spoiled food, which made her regur unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The roller coaster ride was so intense, it made him feel like he might regur.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage made her regur immediately.

meanings.definition: To repeat or recite something by heart.
meanings.sent1: She had to regur the multiplication table for her math test.
meanings.sent2: He could regur all the lyrics to his favorite song without missing a beat.
meanings.sent3: The parrot could regur the phrases it heard its owner say every day.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to regur the main events of the story.
meanings.sent5: He tried to regur the speech he had memorized, but he forgot a few lines.

meanings.definition: A type of soil found in India.
meanings.sent1: Farmers in India use regur soil for growing crops.
meanings.sent2: The regur in the fields helped the plants thrive during the monsoon season.
meanings.sent3: The regur soil was so fertile that it yielded a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The dark color of regur soil indicated its richness in nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the trees reached deep into the regur to find water.
